name: Body, Self and Sociality
description: This seminar class examines 'the body' as a historically and culturally contingent category, the material site and means of practice, and a foundation point for identity and self-fashioning. We consider the relevance of cultural meanings to biomedical practices, the centrality of the body to consumer techno-society, and the bodyâ€™s role as a locus of experience, political inscription, and struggle.
